instruction: Create a Blueprint with a boolean variable IsActive. On BeginPlay, use a Branch node to check IsActive. If true, print Active. If false, print Inactive.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_BranchCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsActive: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsActive]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Active"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Inactive"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute

instruction: bp with a bool var isactive. on beginplay, use a branch to check isactive. if true, print active. if false, print inactive.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_BranchCheck
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsActive: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=IsActive]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Active"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Inactive"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on overlap checks if the overlapping actor has the tag Enemy. If yes, print Danger. If no, print Safe.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TagBranch
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: ActorHasTag [Tag="Enemy"]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Danger"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Safe"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Target [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute

instruction: make a bp that on overlap checks if the overlapping actor has the tag enemy. if yes, print danger. if no, print safe.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_TagBranch
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n2: ActorHasTag [Tag="Enemy"]
NODE n3: Branch
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Danger"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Safe"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n1.OtherActor -> n2.Target [Actor]
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n3.True -> n4.Execute
EXEC n3.False -> n5.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint with an integer variable Score set to 0. On BeginPlay, set Score to 100 then print the value of Score.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SetScore
PARENT: Actor
VAR Score: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableSet [VarName=Score]
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Score]
NODE n4: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA 100 -> n2.Value [Int]
EXEC n2.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n4.InString [String]

instruction: bp with an int var score set to 0. on beginplay, set score to 100 then print the value of score.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SetScore
PARENT: Actor
VAR Score: Int = 0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableSet [VarName=Score]
NODE n3: VariableGet [VarName=Score]
NODE n4: PrintString
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA 100 -> n2.Value [Int]
EXEC n2.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.Value -> n4.InString [String]

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a float variable Health starting at 100.0. On Event AnyDamage, subtract the damage amount from Health and set the new value.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HealthTracker
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_AnyDamage
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n3: Subtract
NODE n4: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n1.Damage -> n3.B [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Value [Float]

instruction: bp with a float variable health starting at 100.0. on event anydamage, subtract the damage amount from health and set the new value.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HealthTracker
PARENT: Actor
VAR Health: Float = 100.0
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_AnyDamage
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Health]
NODE n3: Subtract
NODE n4: VariableSet [VarName=Health]
EXEC n1.Then -> n4.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.A [Float]
DATA n1.Damage -> n3.B [Float]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.Value [Float]

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a custom event called OnActivate. On BeginPlay, call the custom event OnActivate. The OnActivate event prints Activated.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_CustomActivate
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: CallEvent [EventName=OnActivate]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=OnActivate]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Activated"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute

instruction: bp with a custom event called onactivate. on beginplay, call the custom event onactivate. the onactivate event prints activated.

NODE n2: CallEvent [EventName=OnActivate]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=OnActivate]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Activated"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a custom event called OnActivate. On BeginPlay, call the custom event OnActivate. The OnActivate event calls PrintString with text Activated.
output:

PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: CallEvent [EventName=OnActivate]
NODE n3: Event_Custom [EventName=OnActivate]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Activated"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Then -> n4.Execute

NODE n2: PrintString

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a Gate node. On BeginPlay, open the gate. When the player presses the Fire input action, the gate filters execution to print Firing.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GateExample
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Firing"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n4.Execute

instruction: bp with a gate. on beginplay, open the gate. on pressing the fire input, the gate filters execution to print firing.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GateExample
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Firing"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n4.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint where pressing Interact opens a gate and pressing Fire enters the gate to toggle visibility.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_GateToggle
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: Gate
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n4: ToggleVisibility
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Open
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n2.Enter
EXEC n2.Exit -> n4.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that spawns a projectile actor at the player's location when the Fire input is pressed.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnProjectile
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Projectile]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.SpawnTransform [Transform]

instruction: make a bp that spawns a projectile actor at the player's location when the fire input is pressed.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnProjectile
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Fire"]
NODE n2: GetActorLocation
NODE n3: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Projectile]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.SpawnTransform [Transform]

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay spawns 3 enemy actors using a ForEachLoop over an array.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnEnemies
PARENT: Actor
VAR SpawnPoints: Array<Vector>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=SpawnPoints]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Enemy]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.SpawnTransform [Transform]

instruction: make a bp that on beginplay spawns 3 enemy actors with foreachloop over an array.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SpawnEnemies
PARENT: Actor
VAR SpawnPoints: Array<Vector>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=SpawnPoints]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: SpawnActorFromClass [ActorClass=BP_Enemy]
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.SpawnTransform [Transform]

instruction: Create a Blueprint with an array of Actors called Targets. On BeginPlay, use a ForEachLoop to iterate through Targets and call DestroyActor on each one.

GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Targets]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.Target [Actor]

instruction: bp with an array of actors called targets. on beginplay, use a foreachloop to iterate through targets and call destroyactor on each one.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DestroyAll
PARENT: Actor
VAR Targets: Array<Actor>
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableGet [VarName=Targets]
NODE n3: ForEachLoop
NODE n4: DestroyActor
EXEC n1.Then -> n3.Execute
DATA n2.Value -> n3.Array [Array]
EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute
DATA n3.ArrayElement -> n4.Target [Actor]

NODE n4: PrintString

EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute

NODE n4: PrintString

EXEC n3.LoopBody -> n4.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick gets the distance to the player. If the distance is less than 500, print Close.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DistanceCheck
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetPlayerPawn
NODE n3: GetDistanceTo
NODE n4: LessThan [B=500.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Close"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute

instruction: make a bp that on tick gets the distance to the player. if the distance is less than 500, print close.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_DistanceCheck
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetPlayerPawn
NODE n3: GetDistanceTo
NODE n4: LessThan [B=500.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Close"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick checks distance to the player. If less than 200, print Near. If more than 1000, print Far.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_NearFar
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetPlayerPawn
NODE n3: GetDistanceTo
NODE n4: LessThan [B=200.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Near"]
NODE n7: GreaterThan [B=1000.0]
NODE n8: Branch
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="Far"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n5.False -> n8.Execute
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n7.A [Float]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n8.True -> n9.Execute

instruction: make a bp that on tick checks distance to the player. if less than 200, print near. if more than 1000, print far.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_NearFar
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: GetPlayerPawn
NODE n3: GetDistanceTo
NODE n4: LessThan [B=200.0]
NODE n5: Branch
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Near"]
NODE n7: GreaterThan [B=1000.0]
NODE n8: Branch
NODE n9: PrintString [InString="Far"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n5.Execute
DATA n2.ReturnValue -> n3.OtherActor [Actor]
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n4.A [Float]
DATA n4.ReturnValue -> n5.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n5.True -> n6.Execute
EXEC n5.False -> n8.Execute
DATA n3.ReturnValue -> n7.A [Float]
DATA n7.ReturnValue -> n8.Condition [Bool]
EXEC n8.True -> n9.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint with a boolean variable IsVisible starting at true. On BeginPlay, set IsVisible to false and call SetVisibility with NewVisibility set to false.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HideOnStart
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsVisible: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableSet [VarName=IsVisible]
NODE n3: SetVisibility [NewVisibility=false]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA false -> n2.Value [Bool]
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute

instruction: bp with a bool var isvisible starting at true. on beginplay, set isvisible to false and call setvisibility with newvisibility set to false.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_HideOnStart
PARENT: Actor
VAR IsVisible: Bool = true
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: VariableSet [VarName=IsVisible]
NODE n3: SetVisibility [NewVisibility=false]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
DATA false -> n2.Value [Bool]
EXEC n2.Then -> n3.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that toggles visibility each time the player presses Interact. Use a FlipFlop and SetVisibility nodes.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleVis
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetVisibility [NewVisibility=true]
NODE n4: SetVisibility [NewVisibility=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute

instruction: make a bp that toggles visibility each time the player presses interact. use a flipflop and setvisibilitys.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ToggleVis
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Interact"]
NODE n2: FlipFlop
NODE n3: SetVisibility [NewVisibility=true]
NODE n4: SetVisibility [NewVisibility=false]
EXEC n1.Pressed -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.A -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.B -> n4.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on BeginPlay uses a Sequence node to first print Step 1, then print Step 2, then print Step 3.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SequenceSteps
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Sequence
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Step 1"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Step 2"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Step 3"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_2 -> n5.Execute

instruction: make a bp that on beginplay uses a sequence to first print step 1, then print step 2, then print step 3.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_SequenceSteps
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: Sequence
NODE n3: PrintString [InString="Step 1"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Step 2"]
NODE n5: PrintString [InString="Step 3"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_0 -> n3.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_1 -> n4.Execute
EXEC n2.Then_2 -> n5.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint that on Tick adds a rotation of 1.0 on the Yaw axis to make the actor spin continuously.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_Spinner
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_Tick
NODE n2: AddActorLocalRotation [DeltaRotation=(Pitch=0.0,Yaw=1.0,Roll=0.0)]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute

EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute

instruction: Create a Blueprint with three events: BeginPlay prints Ready, pressing Jump prints Jumped, and on overlap prints Touched.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ThreeEvents
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
NODE n1: Event_BeginPlay
NODE n2: PrintString [InString="Ready"]
NODE n3: Event_InputAction [ActionName="Jump"]
NODE n4: PrintString [InString="Jumped"]
NODE n5: Event_ActorBeginOverlap
NODE n6: PrintString [InString="Touched"]
EXEC n1.Then -> n2.Execute
EXEC n3.Pressed -> n4.Execute
EXEC n5.Then -> n6.Execute

instruction: bp with three events: beginplay prints ready, pressing jump prints jumped, and on overlap prints touched.
output:
BLUEPRINT: BP_ThreeEvents
PARENT: Actor
GRAPH: EventGraph
